Package pt.ist.phylolib.command

Interface ICommand<T,​R>

Type Parameters:
T - the input data type for this command
R - the output data type for this command
All Known Implementing Classes:
Algorithm, CL, Correction, Distance, Edmonds, GloballyClosestPairs, GoeBURST, GrapeTree, Hamming, JukesCantor, Kimura, LBR, NeighbourJoining, Optimization, SaitouNei, SL, StudierKeppler, UNJ, UPGMA, UPGMC, WPGMA, WPGMC
public interface ICommand<T,​R>
Responsible for the common operations of a command.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Interface Description
    static interface  ICommand.IGetter<T>
    Represents the input data getter for a command.

  • Method Details

    • run

      static <T,​ R> void run​(Arguments arguments, Context context, Command command, ICommand.IGetter<T> getter, java.util.function.BiConsumer<Options,​R> setter) throws MissingInputException
      Runs the specified command with that input getter and output setter for the given arguments and context.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the input type of the command
      R - the output type of the command
      Parameters:
      arguments - the parsed arguments of the program
      context - the current context of the program
      command - the command to run
      getter - the getter for the data input
      setter - the setter for the data output
      Throws:
      MissingInputException - if a mandatory input is not provided in the arguments or context

    • init

      default void init​(Context context, Options options) throws MissingInputException
      Initializes this command with the given context and options.
      Parameters:
      context - the current context of the program
      options - the options for this command
      Throws:
      MissingInputException - if a mandatory input is not provided in the context or in this command's options

    • process

      R process​(T data)
      Processes this command's input data into an output data.
      Parameters:
      data - the input data of this command
      Returns:
      the output data resultant from processing the input data with this command
